channel.title: Kieran Wood
channel.description: I'm a computer science major, with a minor in philosophy. I love to do open source work, especially in scripting, automation, web development, API's, CLI's and dev ops!

item.title: My Trip Through Tech
item.description: My journey from but a wee imigrant child with a gameboy, to a fullstack developer comfortable in multiple frameworks with a ton of open source projects

item.title: We Have AI at Home
item.description: Ever wanted to be able to generate your own images without a middleman? What about a chat ai? This article will cover everything you need to get started!

item.title: How to give a stranger your credit card
item.description: How do we pay for things safely online? How does encryption happen safely over a network. How does public key encryption work?

item.title: Building a Good Github profile
item.description: Now we have a github profile it's time to make it worth visiting! Intro to VCS Part 4/4

item.title: Intro to Github
item.description: Now we know how to use git we can look at the social aspects of coding. Intro to VCS Part 3/4

item.title: Intro to Git
item.description: Learning how to use git, the most popular VCS system in the world. Intro to VCS Part 2/4

item.title: Intro to VCS's
item.description: How to create versions for your software. Intro to VCS Part 1/4

item.title: HHTTPPP; Creating a CLI
item.description: Allowing users to interface with our HTTP server more easily! HHTTPP; Writing your own HTTP server Part 5/5

item.description: Doing the socket communication for HTTP. HHTTPP; Writing your own HTTP server Part 4/5

item.description: How to parse HTTP requests/responses with regex. HHTTPP; Writing your own HTTP server Part 3/5

item.title: HHTTPPP; Setting up the HTTP protocol
item.description: Starting to setup our code. HHTTPP; Writing your own HTTP server Part 2/5

item.title: Writing your own HTTP server
item.description: Ever wanted to write your own HTTP server? This series will show you how to do it. HHTTPP; Writing your own HTTP server Part 1/5

item.title: How to verify quickly
item.description: How hashing works, and what we use it for when developing applications simply

item.title: Making Things Small
item.description: How compression works with simple examples

item.title: The power of paths
item.description: Representing locations can be hard, but it's important to use good representations in code. This helps us in searching for things in code as well as being able to store types of information efficiently.

item.title: Making categories simpler
item.description: How to set up categories for your content and make filtering easy!

item.title: It's caches all the way down
item.description: Optimizing your applications by running functions less often

item.title: Stealing Like a Developer
item.description: Ever wondered what open source software is? What about how to use other people's code appropriately? We cover the basics of licensing and vendoring in this article!

item.title: How to cheat at CSS
item.description: Write better CSS, by not writing CSS

item.title: Taking your HTML elements further
item.description: How to use HTML attributes effectively in your web pages

item.title: The Dangers of CDN's
item.description: How to avoid the most common vulnerabilities with CDN's
